metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17345 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xen 4.8.x through 4.11.x allowing x86 PV guest OS users to cause a denial of service because mishandling of failed IOMMU operations causes a bug check during the cleanup of a crashed guest.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-amd64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-arm64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-armhf - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> hypervisor packages are in universe. For issues in the hypervisor, add appropriate tags to each section, ex: Tags_xen: universe-binary

criterions.comment: xen package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1').
